title: Cameron Skelton
text:
Cameron Skelton (born 8 March 1995 in <a href="Auckland">Auckland</a>, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>), is a professional <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who plays for <a href="Counties%20Manukau%20Rugby%20Union">Counties Manukau</a>.
He is the brother of Australian international second-row <a href="Will%20Skelton">Will Skelton</a> and represented the <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a> national under-20 team at the <a href="2014%20Junior%20World%20Rugby%20Championship">2014 Junior World Rugby Championship</a>. Born in <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a>, he moved with his family to <a href="Australia">Australia</a> at the age of 7. He is noted for his immense size, and at 207 cm (6 ft 9 ½ in) in height, and 153 kg (24 st 2 lb, 338 lb) in weight, he is both taller and heavier than older brother Will. He wears a size 17 (UK) boot. He is eligible to play for Australia, <a href="New%20Zealand">New Zealand</a> or <a href="Samoa">Samoa</a>.
He was signed by the <a href="Waikato%20Chiefs">Waikato Chiefs</a> in the Summer of 2014.
